diseases.name: fever
diseases.description: A temporary increase in body temperature, often due to an illness.
precautions: Use a cold compress to reduce fever

diseases.name: cold
diseases.description: A viral infection of the upper respiratory tract causing symptoms like a runny nose and sore throat.

diseases.name: diabetes
diseases.description: A chronic condition that affects how your body processes blood sugar (glucose).

diseases.name: Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm
diseases.description: An abdominal aortic aneurysm is a localized enlargement of the abdominal aorta, which can lead to rupture if untreated.
precautions: Avoid smoking and excessive alcohol consumption
Control blood pressure and cholesterol levels
Get regular ultrasound checkups if at risk

diseases.name: AIDS
diseases.description: AIDS is a chronic, potentially life-threatening condition caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV). It severely weakens the immune system, making the body vulnerable to infections and certain cancers.
precautions: Ensure blood transfusions are from safe, screened sources
Adhere to antiretroviral therapy (ART) if diagnosed with HIV

diseases.name: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia
diseases.description: Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia (ALL) is a type of cancer of the blood and bone marrow characterized by an excess of immature white blood cells.
precautions: Follow a healthy diet during treatment
Adhere strictly to the prescribed treatment plan

diseases.name: Hypertension
diseases.description: A condition in which the force of the blood against the artery walls is consistently too high.

diseases.name: Asthma
diseases.description: A chronic respiratory condition that inflames and narrows the airways, causing difficulty in breathing.

diseases.name: Migraine
diseases.description: A neurological condition characterized by intense, debilitating headaches, often accompanied by nausea and sensitivity to light or sound.

diseases.name: Covid
diseases.description: A contagious respiratory illness caused by the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2.
precautions: Wear a mask in crowded places

diseases.name: Acute Flaccid Myelitis
diseases.description: A rare but serious neurological condition that affects the spinal cord, causing muscle weakness and paralysis.
precautions: Practice good hygiene to avoid infections
Seek immediate medical care for sudden muscle weakness

diseases.name: Acute Myeloid Leukemia
diseases.description: A type of cancer that starts in the bone marrow and leads to rapid growth of abnormal white blood cells.
precautions: Follow a healthy diet during treatment
Adhere strictly to the treatment plan

diseases.name: Addison's Disease
diseases.description: A disorder in which the adrenal glands do not produce sufficient hormones.

diseases.name: Alzheimer's Disease
diseases.description: A progressive neurological disorder that causes memory loss, confusion, and cognitive decline.
precautions: Maintain a healthy diet and lifestyle

diseases.name: Alsar
diseases.description: A progressive neurological disease that affects nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord, leading to loss of muscle control.

diseases.name: Anemia
diseases.description: A condition in which the blood lacks sufficient healthy red blood cells or hemoglobin.
precautions: Maintain a diet rich in iron and vitamins
Avoid excessive tea or coffee consumption

diseases.name: Aneurysm
diseases.description: An abnormal bulge or ballooning in the wall of a blood vessel, which can rupture if untreated.

diseases.name: Angina Pectoris
diseases.description: Chest pain or discomfort caused by reduced blood flow to the heart muscle.

diseases.name: Bacterial Meningitis
diseases.description: A severe infection of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord caused by bacteria.
precautions: Avoid close contact with infected individuals

diseases.name: Bell's Palsy
diseases.description: A condition causing sudden, temporary weakness or paralysis of facial muscles.
precautions: Protect the eye on the affected side from drying out

diseases.name: Bladder Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer that begins in the bladder's inner lining.

diseases.name: Blood Clots
diseases.description: The formation of clumps of blood that can block blood flow in veins or arteries.

diseases.name: Bone Cancer
diseases.description: A rare type of cancer that begins in the bones.
precautions: Seek early medical evaluation for persistent bone pain

diseases.name: Borrelia Infection
diseases.description: A bacterial infection transmitted through tick bites.

diseases.name: Botulism
diseases.description: A rare but serious illness caused by a toxin that attacks the body's nerves.
precautions: Get vaccinated against botulism (if at risk)

diseases.name: Breast Cancer
diseases.description: A cancer that forms in the cells of the breasts.

diseases.name: Bronchitis
diseases.description: An inflammation of the bronchial tubes that carry air to and from the lungs.

diseases.name: Bulimia Nervosa
diseases.description: An eating disorder characterized by binge eating followed by purging.

diseases.name: Candidiasis
diseases.description: A fungal infection caused by Candida species.

diseases.name: Cardiomyopathy
diseases.description: A disease of the heart muscle that makes it harder for the heart to pump blood.
precautions: Manage risk factors like hypertension and diabetes

diseases.name: Carpal Tunnel Syndrome
diseases.description: A condition caused by compression of the median nerve in the wrist.

diseases.name: Cat Scratch Fever
diseases.description: An infection caused by bacteria transmitted through cat scratches or bites.

diseases.name: Celiac Disease
diseases.description: An autoimmune disorder triggered by the consumption of gluten.
precautions: Adhere to a strict gluten-free diet

diseases.name: Cervical Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer that occurs in the cells of the cervix.

diseases.name: Chickenpox
diseases.description: A highly contagious viral infection causing an itchy rash and red spots or blisters.
precautions: Avoid close contact with infected individuals

diseases.name: Chlamydia
diseases.description: A common sexually transmitted infection caused by bacteria.

diseases.name: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome
diseases.description: A complex disorder characterized by extreme fatigue that doesn't improve with rest.

diseases.name: Kidney Disease
diseases.description: A long-term condition where the kidneys don't function as well as they should.

diseases.name: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
diseases.description: A chronic inflammatory lung disease that obstructs airflow from the lungs.
precautions: Get vaccinated for flu and pneumonia

diseases.name: Cirrhosis
diseases.description: A late stage of scarring (fibrosis) of the liver caused by many forms of liver diseases and conditions.

diseases.name: Clostridium Difficile Infection
diseases.description: A bacterial infection causing severe diarrhea and colitis.

diseases.name: Colorectal Cancer
diseases.description: A cancer that starts in the colon or rectum.

diseases.name: Congestive Heart Failure
diseases.description: A chronic condition where the heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should.

diseases.name: Conjunctivitis
diseases.description: An inflammation or infection of the outer membrane of the eyeball and the inner eyelid.
precautions: Avoid sharing personal items like towels

diseases.name: Coronary Artery Disease
diseases.description: A condition where the arteries supplying blood to the heart become hardened or narrowed.

diseases.name: Crohn's Disease
diseases.description: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease that affects the lining of the digestive tract.

diseases.name: Cystic Fibrosis
diseases.description: A genetic disorder that affects the lungs and digestive system.

diseases.name: Cytomegalovirus Infection
diseases.description: A common virus that can infect people of all ages, often asymptomatic but can cause severe issues in immunocompromised individuals.
precautions: Avoid close contact with infected individuals

diseases.name: Dengue Fever
diseases.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing flu-like symptoms.

diseases.name: Depression
diseases.description: A common mental health disorder characterized by persistent sadness and loss of interest.

diseases.name: Diabetes Mellitus Type 1
diseases.description: An autoimmune disease where the pancreas produces little or no insulin.

diseases.name: Diabetes Mellitus Type 2
diseases.description: A chronic condition that affects the way the body processes blood sugar (glucose).

diseases.name: Diabetic Ketoacidosis
diseases.description: A serious complication of diabetes that occurs when the body produces high levels of blood acids (ketones).
precautions: Seek immediate medical attention for symptoms

diseases.name: Digestive Disorders
diseases.description: A broad range of conditions affecting the gastrointestinal tract.

diseases.name: Diphtheria
diseases.description: A serious bacterial infection affecting the mucous membranes of the throat and nose.
precautions: Avoid close contact with infected individuals

diseases.name: Diverticulitis
diseases.description: An inflammation or infection in one or more small pouches in the digestive tract.

diseases.name: Down Syndrome
diseases.description: A genetic disorder caused by the presence of an extra chromosome 21.

diseases.name: Drowning
diseases.description: Injury or death caused by suffocation from submersion in liquid.

diseases.name: Coli Infection
diseases.description: A bacterial infection often causing diarrhea and stomach cramps.

diseases.name: Eczema
diseases.description: A condition that makes the skin red, itchy, and inflamed.

diseases.name: Endometrial Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer that begins in the lining of the uterus.

diseases.name: Endocarditis
diseases.description: An infection of the inner lining of the heart chambers and valves.
precautions: Take prophylactic antibiotics before dental procedures (if at risk)

diseases.name: Epilepsy
diseases.description: A neurological disorder characterized by recurrent seizures.

diseases.name: Esophageal Cancer
diseases.description: A cancer that occurs in the esophagus, the tube connecting the throat to the stomach.
precautions: Get screened for Barrett's esophagus (if at risk)

diseases.name: Fibromyalgia
diseases.description: A chronic disorder causing widespread pain, fatigue, and tenderness in localized areas.

diseases.name: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
diseases.description: A digestive disorder where stomach acid frequently flows back into the esophagus.

diseases.name: Gastroenteritis
diseases.description: An intestinal infection causing diarrhea, cramps, nausea, and vomiting.

diseases.name: Glaucoma
diseases.description: A group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, often due to high eye pressure.

diseases.name: Gout
diseases.description: A form of arthritis characterized by severe pain, redness, and tenderness in joints.

diseases.name: Graves' Disease
diseases.description: An autoimmune disorder leading to overproduction of thyroid hormones (hyperthyroidism).

diseases.name: Guillain-Barr√© Syndrome
diseases.description: A rare neurological disorder where the body's immune system attacks the nerves.
precautions: Seek immediate medical attention for symptoms

diseases.name: Hand, Foot, and Mouth Disease
diseases.description: A contagious viral illness common in children, causing sores in the mouth and a rash on the hands and feet.
precautions: Avoid close contact with infected individuals

diseases.name: Hashimoto's Thyroiditis
diseases.description: An autoimmune disorder causing hypothyroidism due to thyroid inflammation.

diseases.name: Heart Attack
diseases.description: A blockage of blood flow to the heart muscle.

diseases.name: Heart Disease
diseases.description: A range of conditions affecting the heart, including coronary artery disease and arrhythmias.

diseases.name: Hemophilia
diseases.description: A rare bleeding disorder where the blood doesn't clot normally.

diseases.name: Hepatitis A
diseases.description: A viral liver infection spread through contaminated food and water.

diseases.name: Hepatitis B
diseases.description: A viral liver infection that can cause chronic disease and liver damage.

diseases.name: Hepatitis C
diseases.description: A viral infection causing liver inflammation and damage.

diseases.name: Herpes Simplex Virus
diseases.description: A viral infection causing sores, typically around the mouth or genitals.

diseases.name: High Blood Pressure (Hypertension)
diseases.description: A chronic condition where the force of blood against artery walls is too high.

diseases.name: HIV/AIDS
diseases.description: A viral infection that attacks the immune system, potentially leading to AIDS.

diseases.name: Hodgkin's Lymphoma
diseases.description: A cancer of the lymphatic system.

diseases.name: Hyperthyroidism
diseases.description: A condition where the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone.

diseases.name: Hypothyroidism
diseases.description: A condition where the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone.

diseases.name: Influenza
diseases.description: A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses.
precautions: Avoid close contact with sick individuals

diseases.name: Inflammatory Bowel Disease
diseases.description: A group of disorders causing chronic inflammation in the digestive tract.

diseases.name: Insomnia
diseases.description: A sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.
precautions: Avoid caffeine and heavy meals before bed

diseases.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
diseases.description: A common disorder affecting the large intestine, causing abdominal pain, bloating, and altered bowel habits.

diseases.name: Kidney Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer originating in the kidneys.

diseases.name: Kidney Stones
diseases.description: Hard mineral and salt deposits that form in the kidneys, often causing severe pain.

diseases.name: Lead Poisoning
diseases.description: A condition caused by exposure to high levels of lead, leading to health issues.

diseases.name: Legionnaires' Disease
diseases.description: A severe form of pneumonia caused by Legionella bacteria.
precautions: Follow regular maintenance of air conditioning systems

diseases.name: Leptospirosis
diseases.description: A bacterial infection spread through water contaminated with animal urine.

diseases.name: Leukemia
diseases.description: A type of cancer affecting blood-forming tissues, including the bone marrow and lymphatic system.

diseases.name: Liver Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer that begins in the liver.

diseases.name: Lung Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer that begins in the lungs, often caused by smoking.

diseases.name: Lupus
diseases.description: An autoimmune disease where the immune system attacks its own tissues.

diseases.name: Lyme Disease
diseases.description: A bacterial infection transmitted through tick bites.
precautions: Check for ticks after outdoor activities

diseases.name: Malaria
diseases.description: A mosquito-borne disease caused by Plasmodium parasites.

diseases.name: Meningitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord.
precautions: Avoid close contact with infected individuals

diseases.name: Metabolic Syndrome
diseases.description: A cluster of conditions increasing the risk of heart disease, stroke, and diabetes.

diseases.name: Multiple Myeloma
diseases.description: A cancer of plasma cells that weakens bones and the immune system.

diseases.name: Muscular Dystrophy
diseases.description: A group of diseases causing progressive weakness and loss of muscle mass.

diseases.name: Myasthenia Gravis
diseases.description: A chronic autoimmune disorder causing muscle weakness.

diseases.name: Narcolepsy
diseases.description: A chronic sleep disorder characterized by overwhelming daytime drowsiness and sudden attacks of sleep.
precautions: Create a safe environment to avoid injury during sudden sleep episodes

diseases.name: Nephritis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the kidneys, which can impair their function.

diseases.name: Neurofibromatosis
diseases.description: A genetic disorder causing tumors to form on nerve tissue.

diseases.name: Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
diseases.description: A cancer of the lymphatic system that can spread to other organs.

diseases.name: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
diseases.description: A common disorder affecting the large intestine, causing abdominal pain, bloating, and altered bowel habits.

diseases.name: Kidney Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer originating in the kidneys.

diseases.name: Kidney Stones
diseases.description: Hard mineral and salt deposits that form in the kidneys, often causing severe pain.

diseases.name: Lead Poisoning
diseases.description: A condition caused by exposure to high levels of lead, leading to health issues.

diseases.name: Legionnaires' Disease
diseases.description: A severe form of pneumonia caused by Legionella bacteria.
precautions: Follow regular maintenance of air conditioning systems

diseases.name: Leptospirosis
diseases.description: A bacterial infection spread through water contaminated with animal urine.

diseases.name: Leukemia
diseases.description: A type of cancer affecting blood-forming tissues, including the bone marrow and lymphatic system.

diseases.name: Liver Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer that begins in the liver.

diseases.name: Lung Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer that begins in the lungs, often caused by smoking.

diseases.name: Lupus
diseases.description: An autoimmune disease where the immune system attacks its own tissues.

diseases.name: Lyme Disease
diseases.description: A bacterial infection transmitted through tick bites.
precautions: Check for ticks after outdoor activities

diseases.name: Malaria
diseases.description: A mosquito-borne disease caused by Plasmodium parasites.

diseases.name: Meningitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the protective membranes covering the brain and spinal cord.
precautions: Avoid close contact with infected individuals

diseases.name: Metabolic Syndrome
diseases.description: A cluster of conditions increasing the risk of heart disease, stroke, and diabetes.

diseases.name: Multiple Myeloma
diseases.description: A cancer of plasma cells that weakens bones and the immune system.

diseases.name: Muscular Dystrophy
diseases.description: A group of diseases causing progressive weakness and loss of muscle mass.

diseases.name: Myasthenia Gravis
diseases.description: A chronic autoimmune disorder causing muscle weakness.

diseases.name: Narcolepsy
diseases.description: A chronic sleep disorder characterized by overwhelming daytime drowsiness and sudden attacks of sleep.
precautions: Create a safe environment to avoid injury during sudden sleep episodes

diseases.name: Nephritis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the kidneys, which can impair their function.

diseases.name: Neurofibromatosis
diseases.description: A genetic disorder causing tumors to form on nerve tissue.

diseases.name: Non-Hodgkin Lymphoma
diseases.description: A cancer of the lymphatic system that can spread to other organs.

diseases.name: Eosinophilic Esophagitis
diseases.description: A chronic immune system disease where eosinophils build up in the esophagus, leading to inflammation and damage.
precautions: Maintain regular follow-ups with a gastroenterologist
Follow a strict elimination diet if prescribed
treatment_options: Dilation of the esophagus in severe cases

diseases.name: Epidermolysis Bullosa
diseases.description: A rare genetic condition that causes fragile, blistering skin.
precautions: Avoid trauma or friction to the skin
Use soft bandages to protect wounds
Maintain a nutritious diet to promote healing

diseases.name: Essential Tremor
diseases.description: A neurological disorder causing involuntary and rhythmic shaking, typically in the hands.
precautions: Avoid caffeine and other tremor triggers
Use adaptive tools to reduce strain

diseases.name: Familial Hypercholesterolemia
diseases.description: An inherited condition leading to high cholesterol levels and an increased risk of heart disease.

diseases.name: Fibromuscular Dysplasia
diseases.description: A condition causing abnormal cell growth in artery walls, leading to narrowing and blockages.

diseases.name: Fragile X Syndrome
diseases.description: A genetic condition causing intellectual disability, behavioral challenges, and distinctive physical features.
precautions: Regularly monitor for associated health issues
treatment_options: Therapies for speech and occupational skills

diseases.name: Gallstones
diseases.description: Hardened deposits of digestive fluid that can form in the gallbladder.

diseases.name: Giant Cell Arteritis
diseases.description: An inflammation of the lining of the arteries, often in the head.
precautions: Monitor symptoms like headaches or vision changes
Follow up regularly with a rheumatologist

diseases.name: Glomerulonephritis
diseases.description: A condition involving inflammation of the kidney's filtering units, leading to impaired kidney function.
precautions: Manage high blood pressure and diabetes
treatment_options: Dialysis or kidney transplant in severe cases

diseases.name: Gouty Arthritis
diseases.description: A form of arthritis caused by the accumulation of urate crystals in the joints.

diseases.name: Iron Deficiency
diseases.description: A condition where the body lacks sufficient iron to produce adequate levels of hemoglobin.
precautions: Include iron-rich foods in your diet
Take vitamin C to enhance iron absorption

diseases.name: Ischemic Heart Disease
diseases.description: A condition caused by reduced blood flow to the heart, often due to coronary artery blockage.
precautions: Avoid smoking and excessive alcohol consumption

diseases.name: Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis
diseases.description: A type of arthritis that affects children, causing joint inflammation and stiffness.
precautions: Encourage physical activity to maintain mobility

diseases.name: Klinefelter Syndrome
diseases.description: A genetic condition in males caused by an extra X chromosome, leading to developmental issues.
precautions: Monitor for associated health risks like osteoporosis

diseases.name: Krabbe Disease
diseases.description: A rare genetic disorder affecting the nervous system, caused by a deficiency of the GALC enzyme.
precautions: Genetic counseling for families at risk
treatment_options: Stem cell transplantation if diagnosed early

diseases.name: Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis
diseases.description: A rare disorder where excess immune cells build up in the body, potentially damaging tissues and organs.
precautions: Regularly monitor bone and organ health
Seek timely medical care for recurring symptoms

diseases.name: Laryngeal Cancer
diseases.description: A cancer that forms in the tissues of the larynx (voice box).

diseases.name: Lichen Planus
diseases.description: An inflammatory condition affecting the skin and mucous membranes, causing itchy, flat-topped bumps.
precautions: Avoid potential irritants like spicy foods for oral lesions
Monitor for associated conditions like hepatitis C
treatment_options: Light therapy for severe skin cases

diseases.name: Lipoedema
diseases.description: A chronic condition involving the accumulation of fat in the lower body, often causing pain and swelling.

diseases.name: Liposarcoma
diseases.description: A rare cancer that begins in fat cells, often occurring in the limbs or abdomen.
precautions: Adopt a healthy lifestyle to support treatment
Seek early intervention for new symptoms

diseases.name: Lou Gehrig's Disease (ALS)
diseases.description: A progressive neurodegenerative disorder affecting nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord.
precautions: Engage in physical therapy to maintain mobility
Use assistive devices for breathing and mobility

diseases.name: Meniere's Disease
diseases.description: A disorder of the inner ear causing vertigo, tinnitus, and hearing loss.
precautions: Reduce salt intake to prevent fluid buildup
Avoid triggers like caffeine and stress

diseases.name: Metastatic Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that has spread from its original site to other parts of the body.
precautions: Adopt a healthy lifestyle to support treatment
Follow up with your oncologist consistently

diseases.name: Mitochondrial Myopathy
diseases.description: A group of neuromuscular diseases caused by genetic defects affecting mitochondria.

diseases.name: Molluscum Contagiosum
diseases.description: A viral skin infection causing raised, pearl-like papules or nodules.
precautions: Do not scratch or pick at lesions

diseases.name: Multiple Sclerosis
diseases.description: A chronic disease where the immune system attacks the protective covering of nerves.

diseases.name: Myelodysplastic Syndromes
diseases.description: A group of disorders caused by poorly formed or dysfunctional blood cells.

diseases.name: Myocarditis
diseases.description: An inflammation of the heart muscle often caused by infections.

diseases.name: Narcolepsy with Cataplexy
diseases.description: A chronic sleep disorder causing overwhelming daytime drowsiness and sudden muscle weakness.
precautions: Avoid alcohol and caffeine before bedtime
Engage in brief naps during the day

diseases.name: Nephrotic Syndrome
diseases.description: A kidney disorder causing excessive protein loss in the urine.
treatment_options: Dialysis or kidney transplant in severe cases

diseases.name: Neurodegeneration with Brain Iron Accumulation
diseases.description: A group of rare genetic disorders characterized by abnormal iron accumulation in the brain.

diseases.name: Neurogenic Bladder
diseases.description: A condition where nerve damage affects bladder control, leading to retention or incontinence.

diseases.name: Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease
diseases.description: A condition caused by fat buildup in the liver in individuals who consume little or no alcohol.
precautions: Adopt a balanced diet rich in vegetables and whole grains

diseases.name: OCD
diseases.description: A mental health disorder characterized by repetitive, unwanted thoughts (obsessions) and/or compulsive behaviors performed in response to the obsessions.
treatment_options: Deep brain stimulation in severe cases

diseases.name: Osteogenesis Imperfecta
diseases.description: A genetic disorder affecting collagen production, resulting in fragile bones, frequent fractures, and skeletal deformities.
precautions: Ensure adequate calcium and vitamin D intake

diseases.name: Osteosarcoma
diseases.description: A malignant bone tumor typically occurring in the long bones, often affecting teenagers and young adults.
precautions: Early detection through imaging and tests

diseases.name: Paget's Disease of Bone
diseases.description: A chronic disorder causing abnormal bone remodeling, leading to enlarged, misshapen, and weakened bones.
precautions: Maintain bone health with calcium and vitamin D

diseases.name: Pancreatic Cancer
diseases.description: A malignant tumor of the pancreas, often presenting late with symptoms such as jaundice, weight loss, and abdominal pain.
precautions: Avoid smoking and excessive alcohol intake
Maintain a healthy diet and lifestyle

diseases.name: Papillary Thyroid Carcinoma
diseases.description: The most common type of thyroid cancer, often presenting as a painless lump in the thyroid gland.
treatment_options: Surgical removal of the thyroid gland

diseases.name: Parasitic Infections
diseases.description: Diseases caused by parasitic organisms such as protozoa, helminths, or ectoparasites, leading to symptoms ranging from mild discomfort to severe systemic illness.
precautions: Use insect repellents in endemic areas

diseases.name: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease
diseases.description: An infection of the female reproductive organs, often caused by sexually transmitted bacteria, leading to pelvic pain and potential infertility.

diseases.name: Pericarditis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the pericardium, the sac surrounding the heart, often causing sharp chest pain that worsens with lying down.

diseases.name: Peripheral Neuropathy
diseases.description: Damage to peripheral nerves resulting in weakness, numbness, and pain, often affecting the hands and feet.
precautions: Avoid repetitive injuries to the affected areas
treatment_options: Nerve repair surgery in severe cases

diseases.name: Pheochromocytoma
diseases.description: A rare adrenal gland tumor that secretes excessive catecholamines, causing high blood pressure, headaches, and sweating.
precautions: Avoid triggers like stress or certain foods

diseases.name: Polycythemia Vera
diseases.description: A blood disorder where the bone marrow produces too many red blood cells, leading to thickened blood and increased risk of clotting.
treatment_options: Phlebotomy to reduce red blood cell levels

diseases.name: Polymyalgia Rheumatica
diseases.description: An inflammatory disorder causing muscle pain and stiffness, particularly in the shoulders and hips, commonly affecting older adults.
precautions: Monitor for associated conditions like giant cell arteritis

diseases.name: Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome (POTS)
diseases.description: A condition characterized by an abnormal increase in heart rate upon standing, leading to dizziness, fainting, and fatigue.

diseases.name: Primary Biliary Cholangitis
diseases.description: A chronic autoimmune liver disease causing progressive destruction of bile ducts, leading to liver damage and cirrhosis.

diseases.name: Primary Sclerosing Cholangitis
diseases.description: A progressive disease causing inflammation and scarring of bile ducts, often associated with inflammatory bowel disease.

diseases.name: Prolactinoma
diseases.description: A benign tumor of the pituitary gland that overproduces prolactin, leading to symptoms such as infertility, decreased libido, and milk production in non-lactating individuals.
treatment_options: Surgical removal of tumor in severe cases

diseases.name: Psoriatic Arthritis
diseases.description: A type of inflammatory arthritis associated with psoriasis, causing joint pain, stiffness, and swelling.

diseases.name: Pulmonary Embolism
diseases.description: A potentially life-threatening condition caused by a blood clot blocking a pulmonary artery in the lungs, leading to chest pain, shortness of breath, and rapid heartbeat.
treatment_options: Surgical clot removal in severe cases

diseases.name: Pulmonary Hypertension
diseases.description: High blood pressure in the arteries of the lungs, causing symptoms such as shortness of breath, fatigue, and chest pain.

diseases.name: Raynaud's Disease
diseases.description: A condition causing episodes of reduced blood flow to fingers and toes, often triggered by cold or stress, leading to color changes and pain.

diseases.name: Relapsing Polychondritis
diseases.description: A rare autoimmune disease causing recurrent inflammation of cartilage, particularly in the ears, nose, and respiratory tract.

diseases.name: Restless Legs Syndrome
diseases.description: A neurological disorder characterized by an uncontrollable urge to move the legs, often accompanied by unpleasant sensations.

diseases.name: Rheumatic Fever
diseases.description: An inflammatory disease following a streptococcal throat infection, potentially affecting the heart, joints, skin, and brain.

diseases.name: Sarcoma
diseases.description: A group of cancers that begin in the bones and soft tissues.

diseases.name: Scleroderma
diseases.description: A group of autoimmune diseases that cause hardening and tightening of the skin and connective tissues.
precautions: Protect skin from cold and injury

diseases.name: Scoliosis
diseases.description: A sideways curvature of the spine that most often occurs during the growth spurt before puberty.

diseases.name: Sepsis
diseases.description: A life-threatening condition caused by the body's response to an infection.
precautions: Seek immediate medical attention for infections

diseases.name: Sj√∂gren's Syndrome
diseases.description: An autoimmune disease that targets moisture-producing glands, leading to dry eyes and mouth.

diseases.name: Spinal Muscular Atrophy
diseases.description: A genetic disorder affecting the control of muscle movement due to loss of motor neurons.

diseases.name: Stiff Person Syndrome
diseases.description: A rare neurological disorder characterized by muscle stiffness and spasms.
precautions: Avoid triggers like stress and cold

diseases.name: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE)
diseases.description: An autoimmune disease where the immune system attacks its own tissues.

diseases.name: Tarlov Cysts
diseases.description: Fluid-filled sacs on the spinal nerve roots, often causing pain and neurological symptoms.

diseases.name: Thrombocytopenia
diseases.description: A condition characterized by a low platelet count in the blood.

diseases.name: Thrombotic Thrombocytopenic Purpura (TTP)
diseases.description: A rare blood disorder causing blood clots to form in small blood vessels.

diseases.name: Tinnitus
diseases.description: The perception of noise or ringing in the ears without an external sound source.

diseases.name: Toxoplasmosis
diseases.description: A disease caused by the parasite Toxoplasma gondii, often spread by undercooked food or cat feces.
precautions: Wash hands after handling soil or cats

diseases.name: Transverse Myelitis
diseases.description: An inflammation of the spinal cord causing sensory and motor issues.

diseases.name: Trigeminal Neuralgia
diseases.description: A chronic pain condition affecting the trigeminal nerve in the face.
precautions: Avoid triggers like cold air or touch

diseases.name: Turner Syndrome
diseases.description: A chromosomal disorder affecting females, characterized by the absence of part or all of a second sex chromosome.

diseases.name: Ulcerative Colitis
diseases.description: A chronic inflammatory bowel disease causing inflammation and ulcers in the digestive tract.

diseases.name: Uveitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the middle layer of the eye, causing pain, redness, and vision issues.

diseases.name: Vasculitis
diseases.description: An inflammation of blood vessels causing changes in their walls.

diseases.name: Von Willebrand Disease
diseases.description: A genetic disorder that impairs the blood's ability to clot.

diseases.name: Wernicke-Korsakoff Syndrome
diseases.description: A neurological disorder caused by a deficiency of vitamin B1 (thiamine).

diseases.name: Wilson's Disease
diseases.description: A genetic disorder that causes excess copper to accumulate in the body.

diseases.name: Xeroderma Pigmentosum
diseases.description: A rare genetic disorder causing extreme sensitivity to ultraviolet rays from sunlight.

diseases.name: Yellow Fever
diseases.description: A viral infection spread by mosquitoes, affecting the liver and kidneys.
precautions: Get vaccinated before traveling to endemic areas
Avoid outdoor activities during peak mosquito hours
treatment_options: Symptomatic treatment as there is no specific antiviral therapy

diseases.name: Zollinger-Ellison Syndrome
diseases.description: A rare disorder where tumors in the pancreas or duodenum cause overproduction of stomach acid.

diseases.name: Acute Respiratory Distress Syndrome (ARDS)
diseases.description: A severe lung condition caused by fluid buildup in the air sacs.
precautions: Seek immediate care for severe respiratory infections

diseases.name: Atypical Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome
diseases.description: A rare condition characterized by the destruction of red blood cells, kidney failure, and low platelet count.
precautions: Follow a healthy diet to manage blood pressure

diseases.name: Bacterial Pneumonia
diseases.description: An infection in the lungs caused by bacteria, leading to inflammation and difficulty breathing.
precautions: Seek timely treatment for respiratory infections

diseases.name: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia
diseases.description: A slow-growing cancer of the blood and bone marrow affecting white blood cells.

diseases.name: Chronic Pain Disorder
diseases.description: A condition characterized by persistent pain that lasts longer than the typical healing time.
precautions: Seek support from mental health professionals

diseases.name: Cystitis
diseases.description: Inflammation of the bladder, often caused by a bacterial infection.

diseases.name: Endometriosis
diseases.description: A disorder in which tissue similar to the lining of the uterus grows outside it, causing pain and fertility issues.

diseases.name: Erythema Multiforme
diseases.description: A hypersensitivity reaction typically triggered by infections or medications, causing skin rashes and blisters.

diseases.name: Cancer
diseases.description: A group of diseases involving abnormal cell growth with the potential to invade or spread to other parts of the body.
precautions: Maintain a healthy diet rich in fruits and vegetables
Regular screening and check-ups for early detection

diseases.name: Heart Attack
diseases.description: A blockage of blood flow to the heart muscle, often caused by a blood clot.
precautions: Control cholesterol and blood pressure levels
Avoid smoking and excessive alcohol consumption

diseases.name: Throat Pain
diseases.description: Discomfort or pain in the throat, often caused by infections, allergies, or irritants.
precautions: Avoid smoking and exposure to irritants
Use a humidifier in dry environments
treatment_options: Rest and avoiding strain on the throat

diseases.name: Menstrual Periods
diseases.description: The monthly shedding of the uterine lining in women of reproductive age, often accompanied by pain or discomfort.
precautions: Maintain a healthy and balanced diet
Stay hydrated and avoid excessive caffeine
treatment_options: Medical intervention for abnormal or heavy periods

diseases.name: Lung Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer that begins in the lungs, often caused by smoking or exposure to carcinogens.
precautions: Quit smoking and avoid exposure to secondhand smoke
Wear protective gear in environments with carcinogens
Undergo regular screenings if at risk

diseases.name: Breast Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that forms in the cells of the breast, typically in the milk ducts or lobules.
precautions: Undergo routine mammograms if at high risk
treatment_options: Surgical removal of the tumor or whole breast (mastectomy)
Hormonal therapy for hormone receptor-positive cancers

diseases.name: Prostate Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that occurs in the prostate gland in men, often growing slowly.
precautions: Maintain a healthy diet and exercise routine

diseases.name: Colorectal Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the colon or rectum, often linked to lifestyle factors and family history.
precautions: Limit red meat and processed foods

diseases.name: Liver Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that starts in the liver, often associated with chronic liver diseases like cirrhosis or hepatitis.
precautions: Regular monitoring of liver health if at risk

diseases.name: Endometriosis
diseases.description: A condition where tissue similar to the lining of the uterus grows outside it, causing pain and fertility issues.
precautions: Maintain a balanced diet rich in anti-inflammatory foods
treatment_options: Fertility treatments for women struggling with conception

diseases.name: Skin Cancer
diseases.description: A type of cancer that forms in the skin cells, most often due to excessive UV radiation exposure.

diseases.name: Ovarian Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that begins in the ovaries, often diagnosed in advanced stages.
precautions: Monitor for symptoms like bloating, pelvic pain
Consider genetic counseling if family history is strong
treatment_options: Surgical removal of ovaries and surrounding tissue

diseases.name: Stomach Pain
diseases.description: Discomfort or pain felt in the abdominal area caused by various conditions.
precautions: Avoid overeating or consuming spicy foods

diseases.name: Cough
diseases.description: A reflex action to clear the throat or airways of mucus or irritants.

diseases.name: Ear Pain
diseases.description: Pain in the ear caused by infections, pressure changes, or injuries.
precautions: Avoid inserting objects into the ear
Protect ears from cold and water
Consult a doctor for persistent pain

diseases.name: Eye Pain
diseases.description: Discomfort or pain in or around the eyes due to strain, injury, or infections.
precautions: Wear protective eyewear in harsh environments

diseases.name: Leg Pain
diseases.description: Pain in the legs caused by injury, strain, or underlying medical conditions.

diseases.name: High Pulse
diseases.description: An abnormally fast heart rate caused by stress, dehydration, or medical conditions.

diseases.name: Pneumonia
diseases.description: Infection that inflames the air sacs in the lungs, potentially filling them with fluid.

diseases.name: Hand Pain
diseases.description: Pain in the hands caused by strain, arthritis, or injury.

diseases.name: Motions
diseases.description: Frequent bowel movements often caused by infections, food intolerances, or stress.

diseases.name: Vomiting
diseases.description: The expulsion of stomach contents through the mouth caused by infections, motion sickness, or other factors.

diseases.name: Back Pain
diseases.description: Pain in the back caused by strain, poor posture, or underlying medical conditions.

diseases.name: Headache
diseases.description: Pain in the head caused by stress, dehydration, or medical conditions.
precautions: Avoid triggers such as loud noise or bright lights

diseases.name: Periods Pain
diseases.description: Painful cramps during menstruation caused by hormonal changes or medical conditions.
precautions: Apply heat to the lower abdomen

diseases.name: Infections
diseases.description: Illness caused by harmful microorganisms such as bacteria, viruses, or fungi.

diseases.name: Blood Pressure
diseases.description: Abnormal blood pressure levels, either high (hypertension) or low (hypotension).
precautions: Maintain a balanced diet low in sodium

diseases.name: Sugar
diseases.description: A chronic condition that affects the body's ability to regulate blood sugar levels.

diseases.name: Thyroid
diseases.description: Conditions affecting the thyroid gland, such as hypothyroidism or hyperthyroidism.
precautions: Maintain a balanced diet with adequate iodine

diseases.name: Viral Fever
diseases.description: A fever caused by viral infections such as influenza or the common cold.

diseases.name: Typhoid Fever
diseases.description: A bacterial infection caused by Salmonella typhi.

diseases.name: Dengue Fever
diseases.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing high fever and joint pain.

diseases.name: Malaria
diseases.description: A mosquito-borne disease caused by Plasmodium parasites.
precautions: Take prophylactic antimalarial drugs if traveling to endemic areas

diseases.name: Yellow Fever
diseases.description: A viral infection transmitted by mosquitoes, often causing jaundice.
precautions: Vaccination before traveling to endemic areas

diseases.name: Rheumatic Fever
diseases.description: An inflammatory disease that develops as a complication of untreated strep throat.
precautions: Complete the full course of antibiotics

diseases.name: Scarlet Fever
diseases.description: A bacterial infection causing a red rash and high fever.

diseases.name: Q Fever
diseases.description: A bacterial infection caused by Coxiella burnetii, often transmitted by animals.
precautions: Ensure proper sanitation in animal environments

diseases.name: Rocky Mountain Spotted Fever
diseases.description: A tick-borne bacterial infection causing high fever and rash.
precautions: Check for ticks after outdoor activities

diseases.name: Relapsing Fever
diseases.description: A bacterial infection causing recurring episodes of fever.
precautions: Avoid exposure to lice and ticks

diseases.name: Lassa Fever
diseases.description: A viral hemorrhagic fever transmitted by rodents.

diseases.name: Hemorrhagic Fever
diseases.description: A group of illnesses caused by viruses like Ebola, leading to fever and bleeding.

diseases.name: Intermittent Fever
diseases.description: A fever that alternates between normal and high temperatures.
precautions: Seek medical diagnosis for underlying conditions
treatment_options: Addressing root causes like infections or malaria

diseases.name: Continuous Fever
diseases.description: A persistently high fever over 24 hours, commonly seen in typhoid fever.
treatment_options: Supportive care or antibiotics if bacterial

diseases.name: Pel-Ebstein Fever
diseases.description: A cyclic fever pattern associated with Hodgkin's lymphoma.
precautions: Follow up on any other associated symptoms

diseases.name: Bladder Cancer
diseases.description: Cancer that starts in the cells of the bladder, often linked to smoking or exposure to chemicals.
precautions: Avoid exposure to carcinogens in the workplace
Drink plenty of fluids to help flush the bladder
treatment_options: Intravesical therapy (medicine delivered directly into the bladder)

greetings.good morning: Good morning! How can I assist you today?
greetings.hello: Hello! How can I help you?
greetings.good afternoon: Good afternoon! How can I assist you?
